# init(delegate:)

**Initializer**

Initializes a pointer interaction object with a specified delegate object.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor init(delegate: (any UIPointerInteractionDelegate)?)
```

## Parameters

- **delegate**: An object the framework calls to respond to pointer movements.

## Discussion

If you create a `UIPointerInteraction` without a delegate by passing `nil` to the initializer, UIKit automatically applies a pointer effect it deems appropriate to the view. Initializing with `nil` is the equivalent of creating a `UIPointerStyle` with [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPointerEffect-swift.enum/automatic(_:)]. Based on the view’s appearance, `.automatic` transforms into one of the concrete effects (`.highlight`, `.lift`, `.hover`).
